_exec_summary.SummaryText:
nned Changes to Improve Safety

PRC-DeSoto International Inc. is committed to the process of continuous improvement.  The commitment extends beyond production into the environmental and safety aspects of all operations.  Changes in the manufacturing equipment, operating practices and process controls are made, as necessary, to assure process reliability and effective minimization of accidental releases.  For additional information, contact Mr. Christer B. Sorensson at (818) 240-2060.

alifornia Specific Information

PRC-DeSoto International, Inc.'s Mojave facility was requested by the Kern County Air Pollution Control District to provide a California Risk Management Plan using the RMP Submit program.  Because Phenol, and Isophorone Diisocyanate (IPDII) are not Federal RMP-listed compounds, the RMP Submit program would not allow input of those two chemicals into the software for reporting purposes.  The Kern County APCD indicated that they would accept a narrative version regarding those two compounds in this executive summary.  

Phenol

Phenol was modeled using the AP-42 emissions factors for spill releases.  The output from that release in units of grams per minute was inputed into the ALOHA model and the MARPLOT mapping program which are U.S.EPA models used in conjunction with RMP Submit.  

Maximum Quantity Stored on Site: 9,829 pounds
Maximum Amount Spilled: 55 gallons
Area of Spill: 25 square meters
Initial Liquid Temperature: 110 degrees F.
Initial Ground Temperature: 140 degrees F.
Initial Evaporation Rate: 550 pounds/hour (100% volatilization)
Wind Speed: 1.5 miles/hour (regulatory default)
Humidity: <5%
Modeled Distance to Level of Concern (Regulatory Default of 250 parts per million): 56 yards (onsite)

Isophorone Diisocyanate (IPDI)

IPDI was modeled using the AP-42 emissions factors for spill releases.  The output from that release in units of poounds per minute was inputed into the ALOHA model and the MARPLOT mapping program which are U.S.EPA models used in conjunction with RMP Submit.  

Maximum Quantity Stored on Site: 5,515 pounds
Maximum Amount Spilled: 55 gallons
Area of Spill: 25 square meters
Initial Liquid Temperature: 110 degrees F.
Initial Ground Temperature: 140 degrees F.
Initial Evaporation Rate: 288 pounds/hour 4.8 pounds per minute for 60 minutes
Wind Speed: 1.5 meters/second (regulatory default)
Humidity: <5%
Modeled Distance to Level of Concern (Regulatory Default of 0.005 parts per million): 287 yards (onsite)

Pla

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
The PRC-DeSoto International, Inc. Mojave, CA facility complies with applicable California and US EPA regulations and applicable Department of Transportation requirements.  PRC-DeSoto also follows the Responsible Care (registered service mark) Code of Management Practices, including the Responsible Care (registered service mark) Community Awareness Emergency Response (CAER).  PRC-DeSoto International is a wholly-owned subsidiary of PPG Industries, Inc. and follows PPG's own Community Awarenes and Emergency Response (CAER) Policy to assure emergency preparedness and foster community right-to-know.  PPG's CAER Policy requires each manufacturing plant to have a pro-active community awareness and emergency response program to handle emergencies that might happen in that facility.  All of these activities form an integral part of PPG's overall Environment, Health and Safety Policy, whose goal is "to market, distribute, and manufacture products globally in a responsible manner that protect employees, neighbors, customers, and the environment."  

Regulated Substances Handled
PRC-DeSoto International Inc.'s Mojave, CA facility produces resins, adhesives and sealants used in the aerospace industry.  The facility stores and uses mixed isomers of Toluene 2, 4 Diisocyanate &Toluene 2, 6 Diisocyanate, both of which are referred to as TDI.  The faciity also stores and uses Allyl Alcohol, Formaldehyde (as 37% Formalin) and Propylene Oxide.  All of these compounds are listed in the US EPA's Risk Management Program.  With the exception of 2,4 & 2,6 TDI, none of the other above listed compounds are stored in quantities that exceed the Federal Threshold Planning Quantities.  The quantities of the above compounds that are stored and used at the Mojave, CA facility exceed the California Threshold Planning Quantities for the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program.  In addition, the Mojave, CA facility also

stores and uses Phenol and Isophorone Diisocyanate which are not subject to the Federal RMP, but are stored  in quantities which are above the California Threshold Planning Quantities under CalARP. 

Worst Case and Alternative Case Release Scenarios

An off-site consequence analysis was performed for the largest quantity of each of the regulated materials stored in any given tank at the facility.  EPA's ALOHA gaussian plume dispersion model was used to predict releases of the regulated compounds using the largest container size that each regulated compound is stored.  

EPA rules require that a worst case scenario be analyzed which would involve the highly unlikely release of the entire contents of the largest container.  Based on EPA RMP criteria, the worst case release scenario does not have offsite impact.

Because the worst case scenario has no off-site impact, no alternative case is required by the RMP regulation.

Five Year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases of any of the Federal RMP or California CalARP compounds that are stored or used above the respective Threshold Planning Quantities in the past five years, which resulted in on-site, or off-site impacts as defined by EPA's RMP criteria.

General Accidental Release Prevention and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

The RMP regulation specifies that covered processes at all plants must be classified as Program Level 1, 2 or 3 processes.  PRC-DeSoto International Inc.'s Mojave, CA processes are all classified as Program Level 1 processes because the Worst-Case Scenario has no off-site impact and because the processes covered have no accidental releases in the past five years that meet the RMP criteria.  Submission of specific prevention program information for Program Level 1 processes is not required in the RMP.

Emergency Response Procedures

PRC-DeSoto International Inc. coordinates emergency response activities (procedures, training, drills, etc.) with the local fire department.
